info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 6:00PM EDT until July 21 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Southeastern Hart County in northeastern Georgia... Southwestern Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina... Southwestern Abbeville County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 559 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of Elberton, or 5 miles northwest of Russell State Park, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Calhoun Falls, Lowndesville, Bobby Brown State Park, Lake Strom Thurmond, Russell State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell, Nuberg, Rice Town and Bobby Brown State Recreation Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
